citeinfo.title: ECSTDB2011.SHP: U.S. Geological Survey East Coast Sediment Texture Database (2011)

pubinfo.pubplace: Woods Hole Coastal and Marine Science Center, Woods Hole, MA
pubinfo.publish: U.S. Geological Survey, Coastal and Marine Geology Program

pubinfo.pubplace: Woods Hole Coastal and Marine Science Center, Woods Hole, MA
pubinfo.publish: U.S. Geological Survey, Coastal and Marine Geology Program

citeinfo.title: USGS East-Coast Sediment Analysis: Procedures, Database, and GIS Data

descript.abstract: This sediment database contains location, description, and texture of samples taken by numerous marine sampling programs. Most of the samples are from the Atlantic Continental Margin of the United States, but some are from as diverse locations as Lake Baikal, Russia, the Hawaiian Islands region, Puerto Rico, the Gulf of Mexico, and Lake Michigan. The database presently contains data for over 26,000 samples, which includes texture data for approximately 3800 samples taken or analyzed by the Atlantic Continental Margin Program (ACMP), a joint U.S. Geological Survey/Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution project conducted from 1962 to 1970. As part of the ACMP, some historical data from samples collected between 1955 and 1962 were also incorporated into the dataset.
descript.purpose: This ArcGIS shapefile contains the locations of marine sediment samples collected and analyzed by the U.S. Geological Survey, Woods Hole Coastal and Marine Science Center starting in 1955 thru January 2011. Distribution of this dataset allows the user the ability to visualize the information in a Geographic Information System.

theme.themekey: Woods Hole Coastal and Marine Science Center

idinfo.useconst: Public domain data from the U.S. Government are freely redistributable with proper metadata and source attribution. Please recognize the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) as the source of this information.

browse.browsed: Location of USGS East Coast surficial sediment samples (ecstdb2011) displayed on world map

idinfo.datacred: The U.S. Geological Survey must be referenced as the originator of the dataset in any future products or research derived from these data.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.6.1500

citeinfo.title: A Visual Basic program to generate sediment grain-size statistics and to extrapolate particle distributions
A Visual Basic program to classify sediments based on gravel-sand-silt-clay ratios
A Visual Basic program to plot sediment grain-size data on ternary diagrams
Data file - Continental Margin Program, Atlantic coast of the United States

serinfo.sername: Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution Reference No. 71-15

dataqual.logic: No additional checks for topological consistency were performed on this data.
dataqual.complete: This dataset is complete inasmuch as it contains all the samples processed at the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS), Woods Hole Coastal and Marine Science Center (WHCMSC) Sediment Laboratory through January 2011.

horizpa.horizpar: Positional accuracy varies due to different systems, datums, and navigational equipment used over the years.

vertacc.vertaccr: Positional accuracy varies due to different systems, datums, and navigational equipment used over the years. This information comes from the scientist and is sometimes incomplete.

srcinfo.srccontr: This Excel spreadsheet contains the accumulated results of the surficial sediment analysis collected and processed by the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS), Woods Hole Coastal and Marine Science Center (WHCMSC) through January 2011. Data collected from December 2004 through January 2011 were appended to the previously published ecstdb2005.xls spreadsheet. This file has been updated as errors in latitudes and longitudes and other information have been corrected for over 100 samples. This combined spreadsheet was the source of the data converted to the ESRI shapefile.

procstep.procdesc: Surficial sediment data from December 2004 through January 2011 were recorded in an Excel (version 2003) spreadsheet. This spreadsheet was appended to ecstdb2005.xls. Errors found in the ecstdb2005.xls data were corrected for approximately 100 samples, as well as some errors found in the more recently completed analyses. The Excel file was edited and a comma-delimited text file was generated. The Excel file was imported into ArcMap 9.2 to create a table with the Add XY Data tool.
The table was then converted to an ArcGIS shapefile (Data, Export Data) to be used as a GIS data layer using ArcMap 9.2.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Number assigned to data based on source.

edom.edomvd: Samples taken before start of the joint USGS/WHOI project.
USGS/WHOI Atlantic Continental Margin Program stations
Samples analyzed by the USGS Woods Hole Coastal and Marine Science Center Sediment Laboratory

attr.attrdef: Unique identification number generated in the sedimentation laboratory of the USGS's Woods Hole Coastal and Marine Science Center. For samples analyzed after 1980 this identifier consists of 2 characters and 3 numerics (e.g. AS114). For samples analyzed prior to 1980, this identifier consists of 4 numerics possibly followed by as many as 2 characters.
attr.attrdefs: USGS East Coast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: Sample name or number as assigned in the field by the Chief Scientist
attr.attrdefs: USGS East Coast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: Name of project or project number under which samples were taken or data generated; sometimes project name indicates a more specific area
attr.attrdefs: USGS East Coast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: Name or number of cruise on which sample collected. Historically cruise identifiers were a combination of ship name, year of cruise and cruise leg. In more recent years, cruise identifier is a sequential serial number assigned to field activities within a specific year.
attr.attrdefs: USGS East Coast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: Name of Principal Investigator or Chief Scientist responsible for data collection (usually first initial and last name) when available.
attr.attrdefs: USGS East Coast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: General geographic area of data collection. Name is general enough to easily locate area on a state map.
attr.attrdefs: USGS East Coast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: Latitude coordinate, in decimal-degrees, of sample location. South latitude recorded as negative values.
attr.attrdefs: USGS East Coast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: Longitude coordinate, in decimal degrees, of sample location. West longitude is recorded as negative values.
attr.attrdefs: USGS East Coast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: Measured depth of water overlying sediment at sample time, not corrected for tides, in meters. No data value -9999.
attr.attrdefs: USGS Eastcoast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: Top depth of the sample below the sediment-water interface, in centimeters. No data value -9999.
attr.attrdefs: USGS Eastcoast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: Bottom depth of the sample below the sediment-water interface, in centimeters. No data value -9999.
attr.attrdefs: USGS Eastcoast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: Device used to collect the sample. A blank indicates unknown device.
attr.attrdefs: USGS Eastcoast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: Weight of dry sample in grams. No data value -9999.
attr.attrdefs: USGS Eastcoast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: Gravel content in percent dry weight of the sample (particles with nominal diameters greater than 2 mm; -1 Phi and larger). No data value -9999.
attr.attrdefs: USGS Eastcoast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: Sand content in percent dry weight of the sample (particles with nominal diameters less than 2 mm, but greater than or equal to 0.0625 mm; 0 Phi through 4 Phi). No data value -9999.
attr.attrdefs: USGS Eastcoast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: Silt content in percent dry weight of the sample (particles with nominal diameters less than 0.0625 mm, but greater than or equal to 0.004 mm; 5 Phi through 8 Phi, inclusive). No data value -9999.
attr.attrdefs: USGS Eastcoast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: Clay content in percent dry weight of the sample (particles with nominal diameters less than 0.004 mm; 9 Phi and smaller). No data value -9999.
attr.attrdefs: USGS Eastcoast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: Sediment Classification - Sediment description based on a rigorous definition, usually Shepard (1954) as modified by Schlee (1973) and Poppe and others ( 2005).
attr.attrdefs: USGS East Coast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: Middle point in the grain size distribution in phi units. No data value -9999.
attr.attrdefs: USGS Eastcoast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: Average value in the grain size distribution in phi units. No data value -9999.
attr.attrdefs: USGS Eastcoast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: Standard deviation (root mean square of the deviations) of the grain size distribution in phi units (sorting). No data value -9999.
attr.attrdefs: USGS Eastcoast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: Skewness (deviation from symmetrical form) of the grain size distribution in phi units. No data value -9999. Calculated values less than -50 and greater than 50 have been set to -9999 as they are erroneous.
attr.attrdefs: USGS Eastcoast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: Kurtosis (degree of curvature near the mode) of the grain size distribution in phi units. No data value -9999. Calculated values less than -50 and greater than 50 were set to -9999 as they are erroneous.
attr.attrdefs: USGS Eastcoast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: Mode 1 class - First mode (particle size that occurs the most number of times) in phi units. Although values are reported from -5 phi to 11 phi, older datasets recorded values beyond this range and modes can occur outside this range. No data value -9999.
attr.attrdefs: USGS East Coast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: Mode 1 strength - Modal strength of the first mode in percent. No data value -9999.
attr.attrdefs: USGS East Coast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: Mode 2 class - Second mode in phi units. Although values are reported from -5 phi to 11 phi, older datasets recorded values beyond this range and modes can occur outside this range. No data value -9999.
attr.attrdefs: USGS East Coast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: Mode 2 strength - Modal strength of the second mode in percent. No data value -9999.
attr.attrdefs: USGS East Coast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: Mode 3 class - Third mode in phi units. Although values are reported from -5 phi to 11 phi, older datasets recorded values beyond this range and modes can occur outside the range. No data value -9999.
attr.attrdefs: USGS East Coast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: Mode 3 strength - Modal strength of the third mode in percent. No data value -9999.
attr.attrdefs: USGS East Coast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: Number of modes. No data value -9999.
attr.attrdefs: USGS East Coast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: -5 Phi - Weight percent of the sample in the -5 Phi fraction and larger (nominal diameter of particles greater than or equal to 32 mm); very coarse pebbles, cobbles, and boulders. No data value -9999.
attr.attrdefs: USGS East Coast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: -4 Phi - Weight percent of the sample in the -4 Phi fraction (nominal diameter of particles greater than or equal to 16 mm, but less than 32 mm); coarse pebbles. No data value -9999.
attr.attrdefs: USGS East Coast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: -3 Phi - Weight percent of the sample in the -3 Phi fraction (nominal diameter of particles greater than or equal to 8 mm, but less than 16 mm); medium pebbles. No data value -9999.
attr.attrdefs: USGS East Coast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: -2 Phi - Weight percent of the sample in the -2 Phi fraction (nominal diameter of particles greater than or equal to 4 mm, but less than 8 mm); fine pebbles. No data value -9999.
attr.attrdefs: USGS East Coast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: -1 Phi - Weight percent of the sample in the -1 Phi fraction (nominal diameter of particles greater than or equal to 2 mm, but less than 4 mm); very fine pebbles (granules). No data value -9999.
attr.attrdefs: USGS East Coast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: 0 Phi - Weight percent of the sample in the 0 Phi fraction (nominal diameters of particles greater than or equal to 1 mm, but less than 2 mm); very coarse sand. No data value -9999.
attr.attrdefs: USGS East Coast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: 1 Phi - Weight percent of the sample in the 1 Phi fraction (nominal diameter of particles greater than or equal to 0.5 mm, but less than 1 mm); coarse sand. No data value -9999.
attr.attrdefs: USGS East Coast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: 2 Phi - Weight percent of the sample in the 2 Phi fraction (nominal diameter of particles greater than or equal to 0.25 mm, but less than 0.5 mm); medium sand. No data value -9999.
attr.attrdefs: USGS East Coast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: 3 Phi - Weight percent of the sample in the 3 Phi fraction (nominal diameter of particles greater than or equal to 0.125 mm, but less than 0.25 mm); fine sand. No data value -9999.
attr.attrdefs: USGS East Coast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: 4 Phi - Weight percent of the sample in the 4 Phi fraction (nominal diameters of particles greater than or equal to .0625 mm, but less than 0.125 mm); very fine sand. No data value -9999.
attr.attrdefs: USGS East Coast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: 5 Phi - Weight percent of the sample in the 5 Phi fraction (nominal diameter of particles greater than or equal to 0.031 mm, but less than 0.0625 mm); coarse silt. No data value -9999.
attr.attrdefs: USGS East Coast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: 6 Phi - Weight percent of the sample in the 6 Phi fraction (nominal diameter of particles greater than or equal to 0.016 mm, but less than 0.031 mm); medium silt. No data value -9999.
attr.attrdefs: USGS East Coast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: 7 Phi - Weight percent of the sample in the 7 Phi fraction (nominal diameter of particles greater than or equal to 0.008 mm, but less than 0.016 mm); fine silt. No data value -9999.
attr.attrdefs: USGS East Coast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: 8 Phi - Weight percent of the sample in the 8 Phi fraction (nominal diameter of particles greater than or equal to 0.004 mm, but less than 0.008 mm); very fine silt. No data value -9999.
attr.attrdefs: USGS East Coast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: 9 Phi - Weight percent of the sample in the 9 Phi fraction (nominal diameter of particles greater than or equal to 0.002 mm, but less than 0.004 mm); coarse clay. No data value -9999.
attr.attrdefs: USGS East Coast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: 10 Phi - Weight percent of the sample in the 10 Phi fraction (nominal diameter of particles greater than or equal to 0.001 mm, but less than 0.002 mm); medium clay. No data value -9999.
attr.attrdefs: USGS East Coast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: 11 Phi - Weight percent of the sample in the 11 Phi fraction and smaller (nominal diameter of particles less than 0.001 mm); fine clay. No data value -9999.
attr.attrdefs: USGS East Coast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: Name (usually first initial and last name) of person who performed the grain size or physical properties analysis
attr.attrdefs: USGS East Coast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: Comments on analyses - Any further information about sediment analysis for all or specific parameters in this table
attr.attrdefs: USGS East Coast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: General lithologic description of sample
attr.attrdefs: USGS East Coast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

attr.attrdef: Comments on sample collection or lithology
attr.attrdefs: USGS East Coast Sediment Texture Database data dictionary

overview.eaover: Location and sediment analysis results for approximately 26,000 samples collected and analyzed by the U.S. Geological Survey, Woods Hole Coastal and Marine Science Center through January 2011. We caution users of this data that in a few samples from some of the older data (from groups 1 and 2) fraction weights and phi weight percents do not add up to 100 +/- 2 percent. This is noted for each affected sample in the Comments section.

Any use of trade, product, or firm names is for descriptive purposes only and does not imply endorsement by the U.S. Government.

digtinfo.formcont: A zip file containing the geospatial data, metadata describing the dataset, and a browse graphic showing the data layer coverage and extent. These data are available as a shapefile, an Excel 2003 spreadsheet, and a comma-delimited text file--all within the WinZip.

onlinopt.accinstr: Data are downloadable via the World Wide Web (WWW).

distinfo.techpreq: These data are available in Environmental Systems Research Institute (ESRI) shapefile format. The user must have ArcGIS or ArcView 3.0 or greater software to read and process the data file. In lieu of ArcView or ArcGIS, the user may utilize another GIS application package capable of importing data. A free data viewer, ArcExplorer, capable of displaying the data is available from ESRI at www.esri.com. The user must have software capable of uncompressing archived zip files, such as WinZip or Pkware. These data are also available in Microsoft Excel 2003 spreadsheet format. The user must have software capable of reading or importing the Excel-formatted data file. These data are also available as a generic ASCII formatted data file. The user must have a software program capable of reading the comma-delimited data file.
